standard_metadata.standard_description: Use decimal notation for fractions with denominators 10 or 100.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Write decimals and fractions greater than 1 shown on grids

question.content: Each big square below represents one whole.    **Express the shaded area as both a mixed number and a decimal.**  **Fraction:**    **Decimal:**

images.alt: A big square with 10 of the 10 equal pieces shaded
A big square with 2 of the 10 equal pieces shaded

hints.content: Each big square represents one whole and has $10$ equal pieces, or *tenths*.
$+$   There are $\greenD{10\text{ tenths}}+\greenD{2 \text{ tenths}}$ shaded. We can write that as a fraction as $\greenD{\dfrac{12}{10}}$ or as $\greenD{1\dfrac{2}{10}}$.  [[☃ explanation 1]]

images.alt: A big square with 10 of the 10 equal pieces shaded, labeled 10 tenths
A big square with 2 of the 10 equal pieces shaded, labeled 2 tenths

hints.content: We can also show the same area using ones and tenths.   $+$   We can use a place value chart to help us write $\purpleD{1 \text{ one}}+\greenD{2 \text{ tenths}} $ as a decimal.  Tens |Ones | $.$ | Tenths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-:  |$\purpleD{1}$|$.$  | $\greenD{2}$

images.alt: A big square labeled 1 one
A big square with 2 of the 10 equal pieces shaded, labeled 2 tenths

hints.content: The shaded area represents the fraction $\dfrac{12}{10}$ and the decimal $1.2$.

hints.content: Each big square represents one whole and has $10$ equal pieces, or *tenths*.

$+$  $+$  $+$   There are $\greenD{10\text{ tenths}}+\greenD{10\text{ tenths}}+{}$ $\greenD{10\text{ tenths}}+\greenD{3 \text{ tenths}}$ shaded. We can write that as a fraction as $\greenD{\dfrac{33}{10}}$ or as $\greenD{3\dfrac{3}{10}}$.  [[☃ explanation 1]]

A big square with 10 of the 10 equal pieces shaded, labeled 10 tenths

A big square labeled 1 one
A big square labeled 1 one
A big square with 3 of the 10 equal pieces shaded, labeled 3 tenths

question.content: Each big square below represents one whole.    **Express the shaded area as both a fraction and a decimal.**  **Fraction:**    **Decimal:**

images.alt: A big square with 100 of the 100 equal pieces shaded
A big square with 5 of the 100 equal pieces shaded

hints.content: Each big square represents one whole and has $100$ equal pieces, or *hundredths*.

$+$   There are $\greenD{100 \text{ hundredths}}$ $+$ $\greenD{5 \text{ hundredths}}$ shaded. We can write that as a fraction as $\greenD{\dfrac{105}{100}}$ or as $\greenD{1\dfrac{5}{100}}$.  [[☃ explanation 1]]

images.alt: A big square with 100 of the 100 equal pieces shaded, labeled 100 hundredths
A big square with 5 of the 100 equal pieces shaded, labeled 5 hundredths

hints.content: We can also show the same area using ones, tenths, and hundredths.   $+$   We can use a place value chart to help us write $\maroonD{1 \text{ one}}+\greenD{5 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens |Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\maroonD{1}$|$.$  | $0$ | $\greenD{5}$

images.alt: A big square labeled 1 one
A big square with 5 of the 100 equal pieces shaded, labeled 5 hundredths

hints.content: The shaded area represents the fraction $\dfrac{105}{100}$ and the decimal $1.05$.

A big square with 19 of the 100 equal pieces shaded, labeled 19 hundredths

hints.content: We can also show the same area using ones, tenths, and hundredths.   $+$  $+$   We can use a place value chart to help us write $\maroonD{1 \text{ one}}+\purpleD{1 \text{ tenth}} + \greenD{9 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens |Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\maroonD{1}$|$.$  | $\purpleD{1}$ | $\greenD{9}$

A big square with 1 of the 10 equal pieces shaded, labeled 1 tenth

question.content: Each square below represents one whole.  **Which two of the following does the shaded area represent?**

images.alt: Two equal-sized squares, the first square divided into ten equal-sized rows all shaded.
A second square is also divided into ten equal-sized rows. The top row is shaded.

hints.content: Each big square represents one whole and has $10$ equal pieces, or *tenths*.
There are $\blueD{11 \text{ tenths}}$ shaded.   $+$

images.alt: Two equal-sized squares, the first square divided into ten equal-sized rows all shaded. Below the square is the label 10.
A second square is also divided into ten equal-sized rows. The top row shaded. Below the square is the label 2. A plus sign is between the 2 squares.

hints.content: We can also express $\blueD{11 \text{ tenths}}$ as $\maroonD{1 \text{ one}}$ and $\blueD{1 \text{ tenth}}$:   [[☃ image 1]]    [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: Two equal-sized squares, the first square is shaded pink.
A second square is divided into ten equal-sized rows. The top row is shaded blue.

hints.content: $\blueD{11 \text{ tenths}}$ as $\maroonD{1 \text{ one}}$ and $\blueD{1 \text{ tenth}}$ as a decimal.  Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\maroonD{1}$|$.$  | $\blue1$ |
The shaded area represents the following:  * $11$ tenths  * $1.1$

question.content: Each square below represents one whole.  **Which two of the following does the shaded area represent?**

images.alt: Two equal-sized squares, the first square divided into ten equal-sized columns all shaded.
A second square is also divided into ten equal-sized columns. The left 8 columns are shaded.

hints.content: Each big square represents one whole and has $10$ equal pieces, or *tenths*.
There are $\blueD{18 \text{ tenths}}$ shaded.  [[☃ image 1]]   $+$  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: The first of two equal-sized squares. This square is divided into ten equal-sized columns all shaded. Below the square is the label 10. A plus sign is between the 2 squares.
The second of two equal-sized squares. This square is also divided into ten equal-sized columns. The left 8 columns are shaded. Below the square is the label 8.

hints.content: We can also express $\blueD{18 \text{ tenths}}$ as $\maroonD{1 \text{ one}}$ and $\blueD{8 \text{ tenths}}$:   [[☃ image 1]]   [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: The first of two equal-sized squares. This square is shaded pink.
The second of two equal-sized squares. This square is divided into ten equal-sized columns. The left 8 columns are shaded blue.

hints.content: Let's use a place value chart to write $\maroonD{1 \text{ one}}$ and $\blueD{8 \text{ tenths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens |Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\maroonD{1}$|$.$  | $\blueD{8}$ |
The shaded area represents the following:  * $18$ tenths  * $1.8$

question.content: Each square below represents one whole.  **Which two of the following does the shaded area represent?**

images.alt: A square divided into ten equal-sized columns. The entire square is shaded blue.
A square divided into ten equal-sized columns. The entire square is shaded blue.
A square divided into ten equal-sized columns. The left five columns are shaded blue.

hints.content: Each big square represents one whole and has $10$ equal pieces, or *tenths*.
There are $\blueD{25 \text{ tenths}}$ shaded.  [[☃ image 1]] $+$ [[☃ image 2]] $+$ [[☃ image 3]]

images.alt: A square divided into ten equal-sized columns. The entire square is shaded blue. Under the square is a label of 10.
A square divided into ten equal-sized columns. The entire square is shaded blue. Under the square is a label of 10.
A square divided into ten equal-sized columns. The left five columns are shaded blue. Under the square is a label of 5.

hints.content: We can express the shaded area as $\maroonD{2 \text{ ones}}$ and $\blueD{5 \text{ tenths}}$:  [[☃ image 1]]   [[☃ image 2]]  [[☃ image 3]]

images.alt: A square that is completely shaded pink.
A square that is completely shaded pink.
A square divided into ten equal-sized columns. The left five columns are shaded blue.

hints.content: Let's use a place value chart to write $\maroonD{2 \text{ ones}}$ and $\blueD{5 \text{ tenths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\maroonD{2}$|$.$  | $\blueD5$ |
The shaded area represents the following:  * $2$ ones and $5$ tenths * $2.5$

question.content: Each big square below represents one whole.  **Which two of the following does the shaded area represent?**

images.alt: Two equal-sized squares, each divided into 100 smaller squares. In the first square, all smaller squares are shaded.
In the second square, the left 9 squares in the bottom row are shaded.

hints.content: Each big square represents one whole and has $100$ equal pieces, or *hundredths*.
There are $\blueD{109 \text{ hundredths}}$ shaded.  [[☃ image 1]]   $+$  [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: The first of two equal-sized squares. This square is divided into 100 smaller squares. All smaller squares are shaded. A label of 100 is under the square. A plus sign is between the two squares.
The second of two equal-sized squares. In this square, the left 9 squares in the bottom row are shaded. A label of 9 is under the square.

hints.content: We can also express $\blueD{109 \text{ hundredths}}$ as $\maroonD{1 \text{ one}}$ and $\blueD{9 \text{ hundredths}}$:    [[☃ image 1]]   [[☃ image 2]]

images.alt: The first of two equal-sized squares. This square is shaded pink.
The second of two equal-sized squares. This square is divided into 100 equal-sized smaller squares. The left 9 squares in the bottom row are shaded blue.

hints.content: Let's use a place value chart to write $\maroonD{1 \text{ one}}$ and $\blueD{9 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens |Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\maroonD{1}$|$.$  |$0$| $\blueD9$
The shaded area represents the following:  * $109$ hundredths  * $1.09$

question.content: Each big square below represents one whole.  **Which two of the following does the shaded area represent?**

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equal-sized smaller squares. The entire square is shaded blue.
A square divided into 100 equal-sized smaller squares. The entire square is shaded blue.
A square divided into 100 equal-sized smaller squares. The bottom 4 rows are shaded blue.

hints.content: Each big square represents one whole and has $100$ equal pieces, or *hundredths*.
There are $\blueD{240 \text{ hundredths}}$ shaded.   $+$ $+$

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equal-sized smaller squares. The entire square is shaded blue. Under the square is the label of 100.
A square divided into 100 equal-sized smaller squares.  The entire square is shaded blue. Under the square is the label of 100.
A square divided into 100 equal-sized smaller squares. The bottom 4 rows are shaded blue. Under the square is the label of 40.

hints.content: We can also express $\blueD{240 \text{ hundredths}}$ as $\maroonD{2 \text{ ones}}$ and $\blueD{40 \text{ hundredths}}$:

images.alt: A square that is completely shaded pink.
A square that is completely shaded pink.
A square divided into 100 smaller squares. The bottom 4 rows are shaded blue.

hints.content: Let's use a place value chart to write $\maroonD{2 \text{ ones}}$ and $\blueD{40 \text{ hundredths}}$ as a decimal.  Tens |Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |$\maroonD{2}$|$.$  |$\blueD4$| $\blueD0$
The shaded area represents the following:  * $240$ hundredths  * $2.40$
